definition:
A *child node* $C$ of a node $P$ in a tree is any node connected to $P$
which has a path distance from the root node $R$ which is one greater
than the path distance between $P$ and $R$.

Drawn in the canonical root-at-top manner, a child node of a node $P$ in
a tree is simply any node immediately below $P$ which is connected to
it.
